intro: Sirmuellera grandis, commonly known as the large sirmuellera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a waxy texture. Sirmuellera grandis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and riverbanks.
